sense.name: make or become longer
sense.commentary: Note: includes both physical and temporal measurements
sense.examples: They staged an unplanned sit-in that grew bigger and bigger as it lengthened to 32 hours. One of the original runways constructed in 1929, this concrete runway was lengthened to 3500 feet. The world-famous golf course is being dramatically lengthened to keep pace with equipment technology. Trains will be lengthened to accommodate additional riders to both airports. His stride lengthened to a dead lope.
